comments.creator: justin.lebar+bug@gmail.com
comments.author: justin.lebar+bug@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
This testcase does the following:

 * Add iframe1 to the DOM.
 * In a timeout, navigate iframe1 to page 1
 * In a timeout, navigate iframe1 to page 2
 * Add iframe 2 to the DOM.
 * In a timeout, navigate iframe2 to page 1
 * In a timeout, navigate iframe2 to page 2

It throws up an alert before each navigation to prevent nondeterministic behavior which I presume is due to the iframe loads racing with one another.

This creates 4 SHEntries.  Click back 4 times to go back to the beginning of the shistory.

Expected results: You should be able to click forward 4 times, just as you were able to click back 4 times.

Actual results: You can click forward only twice, through the first iframe's SHEntries.
comments.text:
Created attachment 563420
Testcase

This testcase does the following:

 * Add iframe1 to the DOM.
 * In a timeout, navigate iframe1 to page 1
 * In a timeout, navigate iframe1 to page 2
 * Add iframe 2 to the DOM.
 * In a timeout, navigate iframe2 to page 1
 * In a timeout, navigate iframe2 to page 2

It throws up an alert before each navigation to prevent nondeterministic behavior which I presume is due to the iframe loads racing with one another.

This creates 4 SHEntries.  Click back 4 times to go back to the beginning of the shistory.

Expected results: You should be able to click forward 4 times, just as you were able to click back 4 times.

Actual results: You can click forward only twice, through the first iframe's SHEntries.
I'm a little curious whether or not this bug is fixed, since it's hard to confirm because of "data:" scheme's session history.
comments.raw_text: I'm a little curious whether or not this bug is fixed, since it's hard to confirm because of "data:" scheme's session history.
